body: You are missing the `next()` call in your `our-db-connector` plugin. The plugin signature is `function plugin (fastify, options, next) {}`. The `next` function must be invoked to properly register the plugin.

@jsumners yes, if you use an *async* plugin there is no need to call `next` :)
And `register` uses `avvio`, which supports promises.

The reason why the code is not working is because the getting started guide has an error, the database connector plugin should be wrapped with [`fastify-plugin`](https://github.com/fastify/fastify-plugin).

I'll update that document very soon, thank your for the report! :)
I've got this code working by wrapping plugin in `fastify-plugin` **AND** using explicit `done()` call in my async plugin function. Using `fastify-plugin` alone was not enough.

issue.title: Fixes #513

repository.name: fastify
repository.description: Fast and low overhead web framework, for Node.js

issue.body:
As titled.

@dolphin278 is this more clear now? :)

body: @dolphin278 Can you paste a gist with your code?

@jsumners checkout avvio's docs, avvio will add some methods to your server instance, such as `use`, `after`, `ready` and so on.
Internally in Fastify we reassign the avvio's `use` to `register`, then `use` to the middie's one.
@delvedor I've remade everything from scratch again and it's worked just fine (`async function` + `fp` without calling `done()`) somehow I messed things up yesterday. Thanks everyone!
